meanings.definition: To signal by waving a flag or light back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The sailor wigwagged the flag to send a message.
meanings.sent2: The traffic controller wigwagged the flashlight to direct the planes.
meanings.sent3: The cheerleader wigwagged her pom-poms to cheer on the team.
meanings.sent4: The wind wigwagged the branches of the tree in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse keeper wigwagged the beacon to guide the ships safely.

meanings.definition: To communicate using a series of signals or gestures.
meanings.sent1: The scouts wigwagged secret messages during the night.
meanings.sent2: The dancers wigwagged their hands to express joy.
meanings.sent3: The mime artist wigwagged his hands comically to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The conductor wigwagged his baton to direct the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The friends wigwagged their hands to plan a surprise party.

meanings.definition: To move back and forth rapidly or repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The pendulum wigwagged back and forth in the clock.
meanings.sent2: The dog's tail wigwagged happily when its owner returned.
meanings.sent3: The windshield wipers wigwagged quickly in the rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: The metronome wigwagged steadily to keep the beat.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's legs wigwagged excitedly as he ran around the park.
